etymology.description: 制(制) (zhì, "to cut out; to make") + 衣(衣) (yī, "clothes") = making clothes or cutting out patterns
etymology.interpretation: The character 製(製) (zhì) combines 制(制) (zhì, "to cut out; to make") as the phonetic component with 衣(衣) (yī, "clothes") as the semantic component, illustrating the idea of manufacturing or tailoring clothes by cutting out fabric.
etymology.simplification: 製(製) (zhì) was simplified to 制(制) (zhì) by merging both the phonetic and semantic elements into a single simplified form.

examples.chinese: 这家工厂製汽车(這家工廠製汽車)。
他们製出新产品(他們製出新產品)，赢得市场赞誉(贏得市場讚譽)。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen zhì chū xīn chǎnpǐn, yíngdé shìchǎng zànyù.
examples.english: They manufacture new products and win market acclaim.

examples.chinese: 大師製古琴(大師製古琴)，传承千年文化(傳承千年文化)。
examples.pinyin: Dàshī zhì gǔqín, chuánchéng qiānnián wénhuà.
examples.english: The master manufactures guqin and passes down a culture of a thousand years.
